column4: yo, im tryin to unmount an ISO from my desktop, cant do it with the GUI, cant do it with umount!
what the
sudo umount /mnt/point ?
its a rosetta stone ISO
sec ill give you the output
you can use fuser to find the processes, if any, that are using open files: http://www.tech-recipes.com/solaris_system_administration_tips1106.html
: ethan@opimusprime:~$ sudo umount /Desktop/"Rosetta Stone Application v2.0.8.1 [h33t PC CD IMAGE]"
/Desktop probably doesn't exist- check `cat /proc/mounts`, then use tab completion instead of the quotes
using ls in the terminal shows /Desktop?
find the real mountpoint with `cat /proc/mounts`, then do sudo umount the full path you find
I just got a giant output here
ill try rooting around in the terminal, will report back
does this look like it would be a rosetta stone CD? i think it does
/dev/loop1 /home/ethan/Desktop/untitled\040folder iso9660 ro,relatime 0 0
quite possibly, yes :)
sudo umount /home/ethan/Desktop/untitl<tab>
youre a dream! worked like a charm
guess i just had the filename wrong
awesome
tab completien will save you from typos
thanks !!
